1.verse: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus because of the command from God our Savior and Christ Jesus our hope,

2.verse: to Timothy, my true spiritual son: Grace, mercy, peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

3.verse: Just as I urged you to stay on in Ephesus while I was traveling to Macedonia, so that you might command certain people not to continue teaching any different doctrine

4.verse: or to devote themselves to endless myths and genealogies, which produce speculations rather than the stewardship from God which is by faith.

5.verse: But the goal of this command is love from a clean heart and a clear conscience and a sincere faith.

6.verse: Some, having fallen short of these things, have wandered away into senseless babble,

7.verse: wishing to be teachers of the law even though they do not understand either what they are saying or concerning what things they are so dogmatically asserting.

8.verse: Now we know that the law is good if someone uses it lawfully,

9.verse: knowing this, that law is not valid for a righteous person but for the lawless and rebellious, irreligious and sinners, unholy and profane, those who beat their fathers and mothers, murderers,

10.verse: fornicators, men who practice homosexuality, kidnappers, liars, perjurers, and everything else that is contrary to healthy teaching,

11.verse: in conformity to the gospel of the glory of the blessed God with which I was entrusted.

12.verse: I continually thank him who strengthened me, Christ Jesus our Lord, since he considered that even I would be faithful, as evidenced by his appointing me to service,

13.verse: even though formerly I was a blasphemer, persecutor, and an insolent person. But I was shown mercy since, being ignorant, I had acted in unbelief;

14.verse: and the grace of our Lord completely overflowed for me with faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.

15.verse: Trustworthy is the saying and worthy of complete acceptance: “Christ Jesus came into the world in order to save sinners,” of whom I am the foremost.

16.verse: But for this reason I was shown mercy: so that in me as foremost Christ Jesus might display his complete patience as an illustration for those who were to believe in him for eternal life.

17.verse: Now to the king of ages, incorruptible, invisible, the only God, be honor and glory for all time. Amen.

18.verse: This command I am entrusting to you, child Timothy, in accordance with the prophecies previously made about you, so that by them you might fight the good fight,

19.verse: holding on to faith and a good conscience. By rejecting their faith and good conscience, some have shipwrecked the faith,

20.verse: among whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have delivered over to Satan so that they might be taught through punishment not to blaspheme.

1.verse: First of all, then, I urge you to make requests, prayers, petitions, and expressions of thanksgiving on behalf of all people

2.verse: —on behalf of kings and all who are in positions of authority—so that we might live out our lives in tranquility and calmness with complete reverence and godly dignity.

3.verse: This is good and pleasing in the sight of God our Savior,

4.verse: who wishes all people to be saved and to come into a knowledge of the truth.

5.verse: For there is one God, and one mediator between God and people; a person, Christ Jesus,

6.verse: who gave himself as a ransom for all, the witness at the proper time.

7.verse: It is with reference to this witness that I was appointed a herald and apostle—I am speaking the truth; I am not lying—a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth.

8.verse: I desire, then, that the men should pray in every place by lifting up holy hands, without anger and arguing.

9.verse: Likewise, I also desire that the women should adorn themselves in respectable attire, with modesty and moderation, not with braided hair and gold or pearls or costly clothing,

10.verse: but with what is appropriate for women who are committed to godliness, namely, with good deeds.

11.verse: A woman should learn in quietness, in all submissiveness;

12.verse: but I do not permit a woman to teach or to exercise authority over a man; rather, she is to be in quietness.

13.verse: For Adam was created first, then Eve.

14.verse: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman, having been deceived, has come into transgression;

15.verse: but she will be saved through childbearing, if they remain in faith and love and holiness, with modesty.

1.verse: Trustworthy is the saying. If anyone aspires to the office of overseer, he is desiring a good work.

2.verse: Therefore, it is necessary for an overseer to be above reproach: a man of one woman, clear-minded, self-controlled, dignified, hospitable, skilled in teaching,

3.verse: not a drunkard, not violent but gracious, not quarrelsome, not a lover of money,

4.verse: managing his own household well, having submissive children with all dignity

5.verse: (for if someone does not know how to manage his own household, how will he care for the church of God?),

6.verse: not a recent convert, lest having become conceited, he fall into the judgment of the devil.

7.verse: And it is also necessary for an overseer to have a good reputation with those outside, lest he fall into reproach, which is the snare of the devil.

8.verse: Deacons, likewise, must be dignified, not gossips, not addicted to wine, not greedy for gain,

9.verse: holding to the mystery of the faith with a clean conscience.

10.verse: And they should also be tested first; then let them serve if they are found above reproach.

11.verse: Wives likewise must be dignified, not slanderers, clear-minded, faithful in all things.

12.verse: Deacons each should be men of one woman, managing children and their own households well.

13.verse: For those who serve well are acquiring a good standing for themselves and great confidence in faith, which is in Christ Jesus.

14.verse: I am writing these things to you, even though I am hoping to come to you quickly,

15.verse: but if I wait, so that you may know how it is necessary for people to conduct themselves in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, a pillar and buttress of the truth.

16.verse: And undeniably great is the mystery of godliness, who was revealed in flesh, was vindicated in spirit, appeared to angels; was preached among the nations, was believed in the world, was taken up in glory.

1.verse: Now the Spirit clearly says that in the last times some of the faith will apostatize by being devoted to deceitful spirits and teachings of demons,

2.verse: by the hypocrisy of liars whose own consciences have been seared,

3.verse: forbidding to marry, demanding abstinence from foods that God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who are faithful and know the truth,

4.verse: since all of God’s creation is good, and nothing is unclean if it is received with thanksgiving;

5.verse: for it is sanctified through the word of God and prayer.

6.verse: By placing these things before the brethren, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, being trained by the words of the faith and of the good teaching that you have followed.

7.verse: But reject the profane and silly myths; rather train yourself for godliness;

8.verse: for bodily exercise is of value for a little while, but godliness is of value for all things because it holds a promise for the present life and for the coming life.

9.verse: Trustworthy is the saying and worthy of complete acceptance,

10.verse: for with respect to this reason we are toiling and struggling, since, “We have placed our hope in the living God, who is the Savior of all people, particularly of those who believe.”

12.verse: Let no one treat you contemptuously because of your youth, but be an example for the faithful in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.

13.verse: Until I come, be devoted to the reading of Scripture, to the exhortation, to the teaching.

14.verse: Do not neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you through prophecy with the laying on of the hands of the body of elders.

15.verse: Continually practice these things, immerse yourself in them, so that your progress might be visible to all.

16.verse: Watch yourself and the teaching; be persistent in them; for by so doing you will save both yourself and those hearing you.

1.verse: Do not rebuke but encourage an older man as a father, younger men as brothers,

2.verse: older women as mothers, younger women as sisters with all purity.

3.verse: Honor widows who are truly widows.

4.verse: But if a certain widow has children or grandchildren, let them learn to show godliness first to their own household and to make some return to their parents; for this is pleasing before God.

5.verse: But the true widow, who has been left totally alone, has set her hope on God and continues in entreaties and prayers night and day.

6.verse: But the one who has lived for pleasure, even though living, has died.

7.verse: Command these things as well, so that they may be above reproach.

8.verse: But if anyone does not care for his own, especially his household members, he has disowned the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.

9.verse: Let a widow be enrolled if she is not less than sixty years old, a woman of one man,

10.verse: being witnessed to by good deeds, if she raised children, if she showed hospitality, if she washed the feet of the saints, if she helped the afflicted, if she earnestly pursued every good work.

11.verse: But refuse to enroll younger widows, for when their passions draw them away from Christ, they desire to marry

12.verse: and come under judgment since they abandoned their former faith.

13.verse: But at the same time they also learn to be idlers, flitting about among houses, but not only idlers but also gossips and busybodies, speaking about things that they should not.

14.verse: So, I wish younger widows to marry, to bear children, to manage their households, to give the Accuser no occasion for slander,

15.verse: for some have already strayed after Satan.

16.verse: If any believing woman has widows, let her care for them, and the church should not be burdened so that it may care for the true widows.

17.verse: Let the elders who have been serving well be considered worthy of double honor, namely, those who are laboring hard at preaching and teaching.

18.verse: For Scripture says, “Do not muzzle an ox that is treading out the grain,” and, “Worthy is the worker of his wage.”

19.verse: Do not accept an accusation against an elder, except on the evidence of two or three witnesses.

20.verse: Confront those who persist in sinning before everyone, so that the rest may stand in fear.

21.verse: I solemnly charge you before God and Christ Jesus and the elect angels that you keep these things without prejudging, doing nothing with partiality.

22.verse: Do not lay hands on anyone quickly or share in the sins of others; keep yourself pure.

23.verse: (No longer drink only water, but use a little wine, on account of your stomach and your frequent illnesses.)

24.verse: The sins of some people are conspicuous, going before them into judgment, but they also follow after some.

25.verse: So also the good works of some are conspicuous, and those that are not conspicuous are not able to be hidden.

1.verse: As many as are under the yoke as slaves should consider their own masters as worthy of all honor so that the name of God and the teaching might not be blasphemed.

2.verse: And let those who have believing masters not despise them because they are brothers; rather, let them serve all the more since those benefiting from their act of kindness are believers and beloved. Teach and urge these things.

3.verse: If someone teaches a different doctrine and does not adhere to the healthy words of our Lord Jesus Christ and the teaching that is according to godliness,

4.verse: he is puffed up with conceit, understanding nothing, but has a sickly craving for speculations and fights about words out of which come envy, strife, slanders, evil suspicions,

5.verse: constant irritations among people who have been corrupted in their mind and have been robbed of the truth, imagining that godliness is a means of profit.

6.verse: Now godliness with contentment is great profit.

7.verse: For we brought nothing into the world, and neither are we able to take anything out;

8.verse: but having food and clothing, with these we will be content.

9.verse: But those wishing to be rich fall into temptation and a snare and many foolish and harmful passions that plunge the people into ruin and destruction.

10.verse: For a root of all kinds of evils is the love of money, by which some, by their craving, were led astray from the faith and have pierced themselves with many pains.

11.verse: But you, man of God, flee these things and pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, endurance, gentleness.

12.verse: Fight the good fight of the faith. Seize hold of the eternal life, to which you were called and about which you confessed the good confession before many witnesses.

13.verse: I urge you, in the presence of God who gives life to all things and Christ Jesus who witnessed in the time of Pontius Pilate the good confession,

14.verse: to keep the commandment unblemished and above reproach until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,

15.verse: which he will make known at the proper time. To the Blessed and only Sovereign, the King of kings and Lord of lords,

16.verse: the only one having immortality, the one dwelling in unapproachable light, whom no person has seen or is able to see, to him be honor and might forever, Amen.

17.verse: Urge the rich in the present age not to be haughty, or to set their hope on the uncertainty of riches but on God who grants to us all things richly for our enjoyment,

18.verse: to do good, to be rich in good deeds, to be generous, sharing,

19.verse: laying up for themselves a good foundation for the coming age, so that they might seize hold of what is truly life.

20.verse: O Timothy, guard the deposit entrusted to you, avoiding the unholy chatter and contradictions of what is falsely named “knowledge,”

21.verse: for by professing it, some have swerved from the faith. Grace be with you.
